column4: wich is the best program for developers like dreamweaver in windows?
are you writing html/css or are you working in something like java and c?
im working with HTML/CSS and java and PHP
geany might be as close as you get to dreamweaver. some people might use eclipse.  but even something like gedit, emacs, or vim could work
but I don't know of anything of the top of my head that does code completion and site synchronization
ok thanks! so they are right for develop site!?
well, it's not as complete as dreamweaver, but better than window's notepad and OSX's textedit
it will do the syntax highlighting, but it won't always catch bad code
are these programs findable on ubuntu software center?
I think so, I know they are in synaptic
so here in ubuntu there is not a program good like deamwaver for develop sites!? do u suggest to install windows alongside ubuntu if i need to develop!?
you can run dreamweaver in wine if you must have dreamweaver. In linux, you're more likely to use more simple tools to accomplish a task than using a single complex tool like dreamweaver
is wine a virtual machine?
so, in linux I use geany and vim to edit my html/css/javascript/php, use chrome and firefox to view the edits, and use gftp to upload the changes to my site
wine "Wine Is Not an Emulator" ... it is not a virtual machine, but an application that lets you run native windows binaries in linux
so with wine i can even run photoshop cs6?
winedb.org has the offical answers. I've ran Photoshop CS5.5 in wine, and I know Illustrator in CS5.5 will not run, but I havent tried dreamweaver
and where i find wine? on software center?
it should be there
check out winedg.org, it will have the answers and the best help on how to get CS6 running in linux
ok! thank u for help!
